title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' three-game winning streak ended by Rockets with a 128-101 loss, amid a dense schedule.
Kevin Durant led the Rockets with 26 points; Amen Thompson and Alperen Sengun also made significant contributions.
Baylor Scheierman led Celtics scoring with 17 points, but a bad free-throw disparity marked the game.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson to the 53-man roster due to Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury.
D'Ernest Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, is expected to debut against the Falcons on Sunday.
Johnson could serve as both a running back and a potential kick returner for the Patriots.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins' defense improved after Charlie McAvoy paired with Nikita Zadorov, leading to three consecutive wins.
The Zadorov-McAvoy pairing allowed just one 5-on-5 goal in 73:24 minutes together, stabilizing the Bruins' defense.
Hampus Lindholm's return and rookie Jonathan Aspirot's performance also contributed to the defensive rebound.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman excelled with 27 saves in the Bruins' 2-1 win against the Hurricanes after rotation tweaks.
Joonas Korpisalo started two consecutive games for Boston, posting a .933 save percentage in wins over Islanders, Sabres.
Coach Marco Sturm noted the flexibility of having two top goaltenders provides more competition and balanced workload.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter offseason with potential free agent departures and payroll flexibility, looking at upgrades in pitching and infield positions.
Key decisions loom for free agents like Alex Bregman, who may opt out, and Giolito, a candidate for a qualifying offer.
Possible offseason trades include solving outfield congestion and targeting pitchers like Joe Ryan as the team assesses needs.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty is set to call his third Patriots game this season for CBS, following wins in Week 2 and Week 7.
McCourty, a former Patriots player, is surprised by the team's swift improvement to a 6-2 record and QB Drake Maye's performance.
McCourty enjoys working in a three-person booth with Andrew Catalon and Charles Davis, providing detailed insights into games.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are reportedly interested in acquiring Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before the trade deadline.
Phillips, a former first-round pick, has recorded three sacks this season and is 11th in pressures among edge rushers.
The Dolphins, with a 2-7 record, might trade Phillips, asking at least a third-round pick for the 26-year-old player.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei was scratched for the third consecutive game against the Hurricanes on Saturday.
Coach Marco Sturm encourages Lohrei to learn from sitting out, citing growth opportunities despite defensive zone struggles.
Nikita Zadorov's pairing with Charlie McAvoy has stabilized the Bruins' defense since Lohrei's benching.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 3-4 record, aiming for a playoff push.
Falcons QB Michael Penix struggles in outdoor games, completing 53.1% of passes with a 65.5 passer rating.
Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and poses a dual-threat as both a runner and receiver.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez played key roles in the Dodgers' 3-1 win over the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Betts hit a crucial two-run single in the third inning, giving the Dodgers an early 3-0 lead.
Hernandez made a critical outfield play, throwing out a runner at second base to end the game.
